channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16983] TestMultiTableSnapshotInputFormat failing with Unable to create region directory: /tmp/...
item.description:
Test is using /tmp. We failed creating dir in /tmp in a few tests from this suite just now:

https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4253/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred/TestMultiTableSnapshotInputFormat/testScanOBBToOPP/


Caused by: java.io.IOException: Unable to create region directory: /tmp/scantest2_snapshot__953e2b2d-22aa-4c6a-a46a-272619f5436e/data/default/scantest2/5629158a49e010e21ac0bd16453b2d8c

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegionFileSystem.createRegionOnFileSystem(HRegionFileSystem.java:896)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.createHRegion(HRegion.java:6520)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.ModifyRegionUtils.createRegion(ModifyRegionUtils.java:205)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.ModifyRegionUtils$1.call(ModifyRegionUtils.java:173)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.ModifyRegionUtils$1.call(ModifyRegionUtils.java:170)

	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)

	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)

	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)

	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)

	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

...

No more detail than this. Let me change it so creates stuff in the test dir that it for sure owns/can write to.
item.summary: TestMultiTableSnapshotInputFormat failing with Unable to create region directory: /tmp/...

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Patch. Let me commit this one-liner.
Pushed to branch-1 and to master.
Ah there is an Umbrella issue HBASE-15374 which aims to avoid using /tmp in UTs.
Thank you Duo Zhang Added link to this issue into the umbrella.

Just for background, this test referred to /tmp since it went in originally a good while ago:


commit 39ab55841d1f6acb649974367e1e3b5be914c017

Author: tedyu <yuzhihong@gmail.com>

Date:   Tue Jun 2 19:36:17 2015 -0700



    HBASE-13356 HBase should provide an InputFormat supporting multiple scans in mapreduce jobs over snapshots (Andrew Mains)

RootDir: file:/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/HBase-1.4/jdk/JDK_1_8/label/yahoo-not-h2/hbase-server/target/test-data/66ffae1c-9f18-4c0f-93bc-b9f8ec5114d0, restoreDir: /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/HBase-1.4/jdk/JDK_1_8/label/yahoo-not-h2/hbase-server/target/test-data/66ffae1c-9f18-4c0f-93bc-b9f8ec5114d0/scantest1_snapshot__6b563b46-6b03-44e5-86d9-36f8712f4ea4

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.snapshot.RestoreSnapshotHelper.copySnapshotForScanner(RestoreSnapshotHelper.java:720)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.MultiTableSnapshotInputFormatImpl.restoreSnapshot(MultiTableSnapshotInputFormatImpl.java:249)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.MultiTableSnapshotInputFormatImpl.restoreSnapshots(MultiTableSnapshotInputFormatImpl.java:243)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.MultiTableSnapshotInputFormatImpl.setInput(MultiTableSnapshotInputFormatImpl.java:80)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestMultiTableSnapshotInputFormat.initJob(TestMultiTableSnapshotInputFormat.java:73)

This ut still failed.
It can use TEST_UTIL.getRandomDir() as the restoreDir.
I test it locally twice and passed.
Reopen for addendum. stack
Should it also go to 1.3 and 1.2 as HBASE-13356 went in there? stack Guanghao Zhang
+1. And is the getRandomDir method already exists in branch-1? You do not add it in the patch for branch-1.
Yes. It already exists in branch-1.

-1 overall

Seems it only fails on branch-1? I tried on master, without the addendum, the rootDir and restoreDir are not the same.

The rootDir is

hdfs://localhost:41207/user/zhangduo/test-data/31b5b6a7-a353-4d5f-ae45-12298655dc86

The restoreDir is

/home/zhangduo/hbase/code/hbase-server/target/test-data/914944eb-425c-4808-89c1-fe3f58566910/scantest1_snapshot__b0c96118-0934-4bfa-a2a2-2e9664130712

Could you please try to find the root cause? Seems we do not start a mini dfs cluster when running this test on branch-1?

Thanks.

In branch-1, MultiTableInputFormatTestBase will call TEST_UTIL.setJobWithoutMRCluster() in setUpBeforeClass. It set USE_LOCAL_FILESYSTEM to true. When start a dfscluster, it will set default fs to dfs cluster uri. But in branch-1, it changed the default fs to local again if USE_LOCAL_FILESYSTEM is true.


    FSUtils.setFsDefault(this.conf, new Path(fs.getUri()));

    if (this.conf.getBoolean(USE_LOCAL_FILESYSTEM, false)) {

      FSUtils.setFsDefault(this.conf, new Path("file:///"));

    }

Is this a feature only introduced in branch-1? Can you find the jira number to see whether they do not commit this to master?

Thanks.
Yes. It was involved by HBASE-14955 and only merged to branch-1.3. MultiTableInputFormatTestBase use this feature after HBASE-14684. So this ut only need be fixed on branch-1?
We thinking randomdir because using test dir is overwriting or something?
I think master and branch-1 should keep the same behavior here so either we revert HBASE-14955 in branch-1 or apply it master. What do you think Heng Chen stack?

This unit test failed on branch-1. This ut set USE_LOCAL_FILESYSTEM is true on branch-1. Then hbase root dir use local file system, too.


java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Restore directory cannot be a sub directory of HBase root directory. -1 overall

Also observing this failure on branch-1 in post-commit check of HBASE-16840, and confirmed through "git bisect" that HBASE-16983 is the first bad commit causing TestMultiTableSnapshotInputFormat to fail in branch-1, FWIW.
Sorry for leaving this aside Guanghao Zhang. Just tried it and indeed my commit broke this test and your addendum does fix. Let me commit.
I pushed addendum to master and to branch-1. Thanks for the patch Guanghao Zhang and sorry for my neglect (thanks to Yu Li for the kick).
Should be the same as you suggest. Let me try it. Reopening HBASE-14955. Thanks Duo Zhang
Whoops. Reverted from master because cherry-pick broke master compile. No getRandomDir in master. Let me add.
Here is the addendum I applied to master branch. Includes forward port of the getRandomDir from HBaseCommonTestingUtility
Re-resolving now. Thanks Guanghao Zhang for the fix. Will take up forward-port of local MR running from HBASE-14955 to master over in the reopened HBASE-14955.
